oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SANDY BEACH STABALIZATION: PRESERVATION OF SHIRARAHAMA BEACH, WAKAYAMA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tsuchiya, Yoshito
Kawata, Yoshiaki
Yamashita, Takao
Shibano, Teruo
Kawasaki, Masahiko
Habara, Shin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beach stabalization
beach preservation
Shirarahama Beach
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It is recognized that beach erosion has become a major problem in many countries of the world, but especially in Japan in relation to human activities such as development of coastal areas and river basins. Shirarahama beach in Wakayama facing the Pacific Ocean is a typical packet beach, but due toeservation of the beach by headlands was proposed. The methodology has shown a very good result in making the beach recovered as eservation of the beach by headlands was proposed. The methodology has shown a very good result in making the beach recovered as a stable sandy beach.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
